title.rendered: New Website Design To Launch June 1

content.rendered:
The Saratoga Springs City School District is excited to announce that after a year of planning, a redesigned version of the website, www.saratogaschools.org, will launch June 1.

In the spring of 2021, the district partnered with Capital Region BOCES Web Services Team to undergo an extensive website planning and design process.  The design process included a school community survey, a review of existing website architecture and analytics, and a reorganization of content. 

The new and improved website has a cleaner, more attractive design and prioritizes the most frequently used content from the old site. The new site is also mobile responsive, meaning the layout adapts to different devices and multiple web browsers. It was designed to fulfill web accessibility requirements under the American Disabilities Act, and enables individuals with vision, hearing, and physical disabilities to more easily access the site. Additionally, with the help of Google Translate, users will be able to translate the entire site into another language. 

Our district continues to strive to make information about our school district accessible to all members of our school community. We hope that everyone finds the newly designed website to be a valuable resource for learning more about our school district. Please note that during the transition, mobile app users may experience errors while the app is updated. 

The Saratoga Springs City School District website averages over 190K page site visits per month. The website provides information on the district and all eight school buildings, access to budget information and Board of Education agendas and minutes, and contact information for all staff and departments within the district.  Parents and guardians can access upcoming events, lunch menus, important documents, and links to technology resources and tools.
